medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset epigastric abdominal pain with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced sudden onset epigastric abdominal pain that awoke him from sleep, described as dull and twisting. Initially, the pain was at its worst, but it later progressed to a throbbing diffuse pain over the abdomen. The patient reported a prior similar episode of pain 2 weeks ago, which subsided spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease status post CABG x 4; Hypertension; Dyslipidemia; Dilated ascending aorta; Abdominal aortic aneurysm; Peripheral vascular disease; Recurrent syncope; Mobitz II second-degree block; Hypercholesterolemia; Pernicious Anemia; Tubular adenomas in colon; BPH; s/p TURP; Testicular nodule; Trigeminal neuralgia; Memory loss/Dementia; Hearing loss; Appendectomy; Stroke; Parkinsons; Possible pulmonary fibrosis.
medical_history.family_history: Sister with breast cancer; two brothers with aneurysms; no family history of colon or prostate cancer; no CAD or known heart disease.
